availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Ambrose G. Gilbert (Green County, Kentucky, schoolteacher and soldier.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, schoolteacher and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Hugh Gilbert and Matilda Gilbert. Married to Margaret E. Thompson in Marshall County, Kentucky, on January 31, 1856. Father of Joseph C. Gilbert. Attended school in Marshall County, Kentucky, in 1850. Served in the 4th Kentucky Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from September 14, 1861, to December 18, 1861. Reported as deserted at Bowling Green, Warren County, Kentucky, on December 18, 1861. Served in the 47th Tennessee Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a first lieutenant from February 7, 1862, to September 20, 1862. Reported as deserted on September 20, 1862. Schoolteacher in Green County, Kentucky, in 1863. Arrested in Green County on December 1, 1863, for service in the Confederate Army. Held as a prisoner of war in Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, from December 7, 1863, to December 9, 1863. Held as a prisoner of war at Johnson's Island, Erie County, Ohio, from December 11, 1863, to May 12, 1865. Signed an oath of loyalty to the U.S. government on May 12, 1865.

ab.bibl:

Unfiled Papers and Slips Belonging in Confederate Compiled Service Records, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M347, Roll 0145.
